# Course syllabus

Part I --- Foundations of psycholinguistics

- Session 1: What is psycholinguistics? What do psycholinguists investigate?

- Session 2: Investigating linguistic meaning using psycholinguistic tools

- Session 3: Investigating language production at the discourse level

- Session 4: Investigating language comprehension at the discourse level

- Session 5: Investigating the relation between production and comprehension

- Session 6: Modeling psycholinguistic data

Part II --- Selected readings

- Session 7: Production studies

- Session 8: Self-paced reading studies

- Session 9: Visual world eye-tracking studies

- Session 10: Mouse-tracking studies

- Session 11: Timing in turn-taking as a window into the production-comprehension interface

- Session 12: Modeling production data

- Session 13: Discourse, cognition and human interaction
